sn47.16:1: At Sāvatthī. Then the Venerable Uttiya approached the Blessed One, paid homage to him, sat down to one side, and said to him:
sn47.16:2: "What four? Here, Uttiya, dwell contemplating the body in the body, ardent, clearly comprehending, mindful, having removed covetousness and displeasure in regard to the world. Dwell contemplating feelings in feelings … mind in mind … phenomena in phenomena, ardent, clearly comprehending, mindful, having removed covetousness and displeasure in regard to the world.
sn47.16:3: Then the Venerable Uttiya, having delighted and rejoiced in the Blessed One's words, rose from his seat …as in preceding sutta… And the Venerable Uttiya became one of the arahants.
